Posts.Content: sissyjane wrote: I'm waiting to see the actual report, but I've been told that my mammogram had some abnormalities. The one I can remember is that a mass has grown in my right breast since my last mammogram a year ago. I also have one which appears stable in my left breast. I've been told I need a six month follow up. I also remember something about a benign opacity...whatever that means. What do I do? Should I have a second opinion? Just wait six months? Help! Posts.Title: Do Benign Masses Grow sissyjane TenderIsOurMight

Posts.Content: Apr 26, 2008 11:22AM sissyjane wrote: I am scheduled to have a diagnostic mammogram and an ultrasound on this coming Thursday. It's a three hour ride each way.... One minute I'm really nervous, and the next I'm OK. If I keep myself occupied I'm fine, at least until bed-time.
Posts.Title: Do Benign Masses Grow sissyjane TenderIsOurMight

Posts.Content: Apr 20, 2008 12:33PM sissyjane wrote: Thank you Tender for your thoughtful and understanding comment. I'm expecting to recieve a copy of the radiologists report in the mail tomorrow. Just today in the shower, I did feel a small lump, and another factor is that I've been on HRT for nineteen years. Tomorrow I'm getting the ball rolling. I'm calling a breast center in a large hospital. I live in a small community with a small community hospital. I think it's time to consult with a breast specialist. My Internist's exact comment was" I apologize for obsessive compulsive radiologists" I think I'm done with him. Thanks again
Posts.Title: Do Benign Masses Grow sissyjane TenderIsOurMight

Posts.Content: Apr 21, 2008 01:24PM sissyjane wrote: I just spoke with a radiologist at a large breast center regarding my mammography report. He has suggested that I go there for a diagnostic mammogram, and an ultrasound. My report states that the "predominately benign appearing opacity" has subtly grown.... I'm not happy with the description, so I'm getting it looked at by breast experts.
Posts.Title: Do Benign Masses Grow sissyjane TenderIsOurMight

Posts.Content: sissyjane wrote: I've been reading many subjects, and still can't believe I'm here... I had an abnormal  mammogram, and on this Thursday I am driving three hours, to a major Breast Center to have further tests.  I'm having an Ultrasound, and a Diagnostic Mammogram. My screening mammogram results said--"Predominately benign appearing opacity which has subtly grown since last mammogram". Doesn't the word predominately mean most??? What about the rest of it? I'm very confused.... Do you think I will have to have a biopsy?  I'm having my husband drive me , just in case.... It's a very long drive. I've been reading this forum all weekend, and even though I'm probably very worried about nothing I want all of you to know that I'm very proud of you, and I'm in awe of your power and strength. Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Diagnostc Mamm. and Ultrasound = Biopsy???? sissyjane Dukemom2
